definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
Umayyad Empire (661-750, in Iberia -1031), successor of the Rashidun caliphate
Karakhan dynasty of central Asia, 8th-10th century
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC

Silla, Korean kingdom 57 BC-935 AD/one of the Korean Three Kingdoms from 1st century AD, defeating its rivals Paikche 百濟|百济[Bai3 ji4] and Koguryo 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2] around 660 in alliance with Tang China/unified Silla 658-935
Sassanid Empire of Persia (c. 2nd-7th century AD)
Sassanid Empire of Persia (c. 2nd-7th century AD)

sentences.english: He was motivated by the hope of fathering a male heir to the Tudor Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他這樣做是爲了都鐸王朝能有一名男性繼承人。

sentences.english: Hundred Years' Translation Movement began to arise in Abbasid Dynasty of Arab in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 百年翻譯運動興起於中世紀阿拉伯的阿拔斯王朝。

sentences.english: In China they helped cause the collapse of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 而在中國，又促成了明王朝的滅亡。

sentences.english: So then the self-proclaimed Fire Song Dynasty, Zhao Germany .
sentences.chinese: 於是趙宋王朝便自命爲火德。

sentences.english: The late Silla split Wang was finally unified, the establishment of the Korean dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 新羅後期分裂，最後被王建統一，建立了高麗王朝。

sentences.english: Ever since the 3rd dynasty drinking it while eating bread was considered a good omen.
sentences.chinese: 早在第三王朝，喝酒吃麪包被視爲是吉兆。

sentences.english: He became a faithful restoration dynasty pawns .
sentences.chinese: 他成了復辟王朝的忠實走卒。

sentences.english: Formerly the seat of a Rajput dynasty, it was later captured by the Sikhs.
sentences.chinese: 從前是拉其普特王朝的統治中心，後來被錫克人佔領。

sentences.english: Oing dynasty was a unified multi-national dynasty of the last one of our country.
sentences.chinese: 清朝是我國最後一個統一的多民族封建王朝。

sentences.english: Colonization took place during the Habsburg dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 開拓殖民地在哈布斯堡王朝就進行過。

sentences.english: The Wan-li period is a critical period for the Ming Dynasty's collapse.
sentences.chinese: 明萬曆時期是明王朝走向崩潰的一個重要時期。

sentences.english: Ptolemaic Egypt was an important historical period during the development of ancient Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 托勒密王朝是古代埃及史上一個重要歷史時期。

sentences.english: In this lecture, I shall concentrate on the early years of Charles reign.
sentences.chinese: 這一節課我將着重講查理王朝的早期統治時期。

sentences.english: Therefore, Dengfeng became the popular location for the capitals and cultural center of early dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 因此，登封成爲首都和早期王朝文化中心的熱門地點。

sentences.english: It became known as Shen Prefecture in the Jin Dynasty and Shenyang Path in the Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 它成爲縣被稱爲沉金代王朝路徑和瀋陽元。

sentences.english: The timing of the North’s deadly attacks on the South this year isn’t a coincidence; the Kim Dynasty is in self-preservation mode.
sentences.chinese: 對韓國致命攻擊並非巧合，金氏王朝僅在自我保護。

definition: the imperial court/the government in imperial times
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
